intro: Lycianthes tysoniana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces yellow, bell-shaped flowers that are typically 5-7 cm in length. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
